body_html: as @dave-andersen pointed out here some operations have not been registered for double simply to reduce the bloat in the binaries, given that, as far as I understand, it was not clear whether there'd be much interest in supporting double precision. Obviously there's been quite some interest so we should go ahead. For some operations it should be as simple as registering the kernel for double, and checking that the tests are there. Some other operations might require tailored optimization. I have been busy with some other stuff, so I have not been able to work on a PR yet, but @siddharth-agrawal if you start one I'll follow it and contribute as soon as possible.
body_text: as @dave-andersen pointed out here some operations have not been registered for double simply to reduce the bloat in the binaries, given that, as far as I understand, it was not clear whether there'd be much interest in supporting double precision. Obviously there's been quite some interest so we should go ahead. For some operations it should be as simple as registering the kernel for double, and checking that the tests are there. Some other operations might require tailored optimization. I have been busy with some other stuff, so I have not been able to work on a PR yet, but @siddharth-agrawal if you start one I'll follow it and contribute as soon as possible.
body: as @dave-andersen pointed out [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35443080/tensorflow-critical-graph-operations-assigned-to-cpu-rather-than-gpu) some operations have not been registered for double simply to reduce the bloat in the binaries, given that, as far as I understand, it was not clear whether there'd be much interest in supporting double precision. Obviously there's been quite some interest so we should go ahead. For some operations it should be as simple as registering the kernel for double, and checking that the tests are there. Some other operations might require tailored optimization. I have been busy with some other stuff, so I have not been able to work on a PR yet, but @siddharth-agrawal if you start one I'll follow it and contribute as soon as possible.
